data.title: The A.B.C. Murders by Agatha Christie
data.meta_description: abc review.docx - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. The document provides a review of Agatha Christie's novel "The ABC Murders". It summarizes that the novel features a serial killer murdering people in alphabetical order, taunting famous detective Hercule Poirot with clues. Poirot uses all his mental abilities to understand the killer's motives and catch him. The review praises Christie's skills as a mystery writer and says the novel was innovative in exploring the psychology of serial killers and switching between narration perspectives. It also provides context on adaptations and influence of the novel in other works.
data.text: The A.B.C. Murders by Agatha Christie
